Title: Law and the Historic Preservation Commission
Publisher: National Alliance of Preservation Commissions
Description: Published by Cultural Resources Partnership Notes, this article provides an overview of laws and legal actions pertaining to historic preservation commissions.

Title: For the Record: A Short Guide to Parliamentary Procedure
Publisher: National Alliance of Preservation Commissions
Description: A Short Guide to Parliamentary Procedure

Title: Local Preservation Ordinances
Publisher: National Alliance of Preservation Commissions
Description: This article looks at aspects of creating, amending, and reviewing preservation ordinances, as well as providing information on aspects of historic preservation and conservation overlay zones.

Title: Assessing Economic Hardship Claims
Publisher: National Alliance of Preservation Commissions
Description: This article looks at the components of economic hardship claims and gives advice on how to evaluate the evidence presented within the claim.

Title: Building Codes vs Preservation of Historic Property
Publisher: National Alliance of Preservation Commissions
Description: This article provides insight on how to implement present-day building codes for historic buildings.

Title: Cities “Get Smart” Without State Initiatives
Publisher: National Alliance of Preservation Commissions
Description: This article supplies information on the benefits of using Smart Codes – building codes meant to encourage alteration and reuse of existing buildings – when establishing or amending municipal building codes.

Title: Smart Codes in Your Community
Publisher: National Alliance of Preservation Commissions
Description: This report provides an overview of general laws and regulations that govern the use and reuse of existing buildings. The report also supplies examples of efforts to reduce the complexity of laws and regulations pertaining to existing buildings, and provides possible strategies to implement reinvestment in the existing building infrastructure.

Title: Regulations to Prevent Demolitions & Avoid Taking
Publisher: National Alliance of Preservation Commissions
Description: Published by the City of Dallas, this document provides the process by which an owner may apply for permission to tear down a neglected building, on what basis the ruling commission must act, and the process by which someone can appeal the commission’s decision.

Title: Sample Ordinances
Publisher: National Alliance of Preservation Commissions
Description: This document looks at the cities of New York, Detroit, and New Orleans and their respective ordinances pertaining to demolition by neglect.

Title: New Exterior Additions to Historic Buildings
Publisher: National Alliance of Preservation Commissions
Description: This article talks about the improvements of and changes to the revised Preservation Brief 14, which deals with how to appropriately apply exterior additions.

Title: Growing Pains
Publisher: National Alliance of Preservation Commissions
Description: Controlling Additions in Historic Neighborhoods (The Alliance Review)

Title: Regulating New Construction in Historic Districts: Contemporary Design
Publisher: National Alliance of Preservation Commissions

Title: Why Say “No” to Vinyl Windows
Publisher: National Alliance of Preservation Commissions
Description: Presented in a pamphlet by the Albany (NY) Landmark Advisory Commission, this document looks at a number of reasons why vinyl windows are a poor replacement for historic wood windows.

Title: Developing a Materials Evaluation Methodology
Publisher: National Alliance of Preservation Commissions
Description: This two part article looks at how to effectively address a number of concerns when evaluating the benefits of substitute materials. These concerns vary in topic, and include durability, price, and sustainability.

Title: Vinyl is Not Final
Publisher: National Alliance of Preservation Commissions
Description: This article, published by the Kansas State Historical Society, provides information on the many downfalls of vinyl siding as a replacement for historic siding materials.

Title: What Replacement Windows Can’t Replace
Publisher: National Alliance of Preservation Commissions
Description: The Real Cost of Removing Historic Windows

Title: Establishing a Demolition by Neglect Ordinance
Publisher: National Alliance of Preservation Commissions
Description: This article covers the fundamental legal principles and key components of a demolition by neglect ordinance.
